newsitem.title: UK: BFI down 11 as Panamax weakness prevails.
newsitem.headline: BFI down 11 as Panamax weakness prevails.

text.p: The Baltic Freight Index (BFI) was down 11 points on Friday to 1,274.
Brokers said that despite the firmness of Caper rates in the Atlantic, the declining fortunes of Panamaxes, especially in the Atlantic, have proved the stronger influence on the BFI.
Cargill are understood to have fixed a further Panamax barley stem for mid-June from St.Lawrence to Saudi Arabia at less than the rate fixed earlier this week of $20.50 basis Red Sea.

MSK have fixed 54,000 heavy grain USGulf to Japan with Shinwa tonnage for July at $20.25 no combo, down $1.05 cents from the last reported fixture on this route by Halla which was for mid-June loading.
At 1200 GMT BIFFEX was unchanged to 10 points lower and turnover was four lots.
